We find that in Deuteronomy chapter 13 in verse number five and then seven more times in the book of Deuteronomy, the Bible says that they are to, that God's people, they are to put evil away from among you. And so we find that God has given them that instruction multiple times in the book of Deuteronomy to not only do no evil, but to put evil away from among you. We find that he tells his people that evil would befall them. Why? Because ye will do evil. The consequences of doing evil is God's judgment. We see that in Deuteronomy 31 in verse 29. We find that God is telling his people to do no evil, to put evil away from among you, but then he tells them that evil is going to befall you because ye will do evil. God knows all things and he knew the behavior of the children of Israel and what they would do and the judgment that would therefore come and therefore he pronounces that even in Deuteronomy chapter 31.
